results.title: W.B Yeats: a tribute
results.creator_credit: George Fleischmann, John Desmond Sheridan and National Film Institute of Ireland
results.brief_description: The life story of the Irish poet, William Butler Yeats, is told against scenes of places which influenced his life and work, including his home county of Sligo and the Abbey Theatre in Dublin. Relevant quotations from his poems are read to create an impression of the man and his work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Fleischmann, John Desmond Sheridan and National Film Institute of Ireland

results.title: VUWAE 15, Darwin Mountains, Antarctica
results.creator_credit: John Pettigrew, Peter Barrett and Victoria University of Wellington Antarctic Expedition
results.brief_description: Shows the geological research carried out by members of the fifteenth Victoria University of Wellington Antarctic Expedition (VUWAE 15). A party of four measure and describe the exposed outcrops of the Darwin Mountains, part of the Transantarctic Mountains. Presents a detailed description of the geology of the area.

results.title: Vukani awake
results.creator_credit: Lionel Ngakane and Concord Films Council for the African National Congress
results.brief_description: Shows the plight of black Africans in South Africa. The first film of protest against the South African situation made by a South African, Lionel Ngakane. Some of the original footage was smuggled out of South Africa, while the compilation material was assembled from a wide variety of African and British sources.

results.title: Voronet
results.brief_description: A detailed presentation of the painted and carved stone frescoes at Voronet monastery in Romania. Showing Byzantine influence, the church was decorated when Moldavian culture was at its height in 1488 during the reign of Stephen the Great. The work is full of life and local colour; its diversity of style reflects the imprint of each artists’ personality. Includes paintings in the knave, vault, porch and exterior walls, one of which is like an Eastern carpet with human figures depicted against an azure background amid floral motifs.

results.title: Vitamin 'A' from the sea
results.creator_credit: Department of Visual Aids, University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: With supplies of liver oil cut off from overseas during wartime, research was undertaken to find a local product as a source of vitamin concentrates. A valuable source of oil, often richer in vitamins than that previously obtained from overseas, was found in the livers of snapper shark caught in waters south of Victoria. The film illustrates the work of the Bass Strait fishing fleet and shows how the liver oil is processed at a Melbourne factory to produce the active ingredient used in a series of vitamin-rich products.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Department of Visual Aids, University of Melbourne

results.title: Vision in our valley
results.brief_description: This film discusses the economic and environmental problems of the Muskingum Watershed, which makes up 1/5 of the State of Ohio. The area was becoming more poor due to frequent floods, droughts and intensive farming. Through co-operation among various agencies, the area has become completely renewed. By explaining how this happened, the film makes suggestions for solutions to similar problems of conservation elsewhere.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: the unit circle
results.brief_description: Gives an activity to determine the mathematical relationship “sine” and shows how to apply the principle of “sine” in measuring the heights of various objects.
